title: Zero
excerpt: Zero is a new kind of sync engine powered by queries. Rather than syncing entire tables, you write queries directly in your client code that can access the entire backend database. Zero caches query data locally and reuses it automatically, making almost all queries instant while falling back to the server when needed.

title: Actual
excerpt: Actual | Actual Budget Documentation

title: Evolu
excerpt: Evolu - Local-First Platform Designed for Privacy, Ease of Use, and No Vendor Lock-In ‚Äì Evolu

title: Automerge
excerpt: Automerge is a library of data structures for building collaborative applications.

title: Muse
excerpt: Muse is a canvas for thinking that helps you get clarity on things that matter. Think in private or collaborate with others. Available for iPad and Mac.

title: Tweek
excerpt: Tweek is a FREE personal and shared to do list app to organize your tasks and collaborate on them online with your team or family. It provides a weekly calendar view mode and a reminder app. Tweek is an online daily and weekly planner that boosts your productivity to the best level. Instantly plan and organize your week todos!

title: PowerSync
excerpt: Sync engine for building local-first apps with instantly-responsive UI/UX and simplified state transfer. Connects to Postgres, MongoDB and MySQL backend databases.

title: MySQLSync
excerpt: A synchronization solution that connects MySQL with mobile applications, which can reuse the same database schema in a local SQLite instance and sync automatically in both directions.

title: Fig
excerpt: Fig allows freelancers like you to manage your finances, while saving for retirement. Our platform includes retirement plans, including Solo401k & IRA's, as well as expense management tools for day-to-day finances.

title: TinyBase
excerpt: The reactive data store for local-first apps.

title: TinyHub
excerpt: A local-first GitHub client, built in public. Contribute to tinyplex/tinyhub development by creating an account on GitHub.

title: Tangent Notes
excerpt: Tangent Notes

title: Obsidian
excerpt: Obsidian is the private and flexible note-taking app that adapts to the way you think.

title: Anytype
excerpt: for those who celebrate trust & autonomy.

title: acreom
excerpt: acreom is the integrated markdown knowledge base with tasks. Your personal daily driver for your dev workflow.

title: Logseq
excerpt: A privacy-first, open-source platform for knowledge management and collaboration.

title: Onlook
excerpt: The power of Figma for your own app. Onlook lets you edit your React app and write your changes back to code in real-time. Download the open-source, local-first desktop app today.

title: AFFiNE
excerpt: The universal editor that lets you work, play, present or create just about anything.

title: Tender
excerpt: Tender is an inbox-zero spending tracker app that's fast, simple, and secure.

title: Dexie.js
excerpt: The easiest way to use IndexedDB. A lightweight, minimalistic wrapper that provides a straightforward API for developers using IndexedDB.

title: DXOS
excerpt: The Decentralized Operating System

title: Dat Stack
excerpt: dat-ecosystem is a post-web p2p community of projects - Most projects are self funded. Some of the projects contribute maintainance and development to core pieces of the Dat ecosystem while others create high level applications built on top of p2p protocols.

title: ElectricSQL
excerpt: Sync little subsets of your Postgres data into local apps and services.

title: Liveblocks
excerpt: Ship features like comments, notifications, a text editor, or build any collaborative experience in days, not months. Engage users, fuel creativity, and drive growth. Finally.

title: Fireproof
excerpt: Simplify your application state with Fireproof.

title: Gun
excerpt: Decentralized Database

title: Instant
excerpt: We make you productive by giving your frontend a real-time database.

title: m-ld
excerpt: m-ld

title: NextGraph
excerpt: Features a social network, shared documents, productivity tools, an app store, and more! You can use NextGraph for free. It is decentralized, resilient, secure, private and encrypted. You own your data and software! Developers can build new web3.0 local-first apps with our open source framework, based on open standards, with CRDTs, E2EE, Semantic Web, RDF, SPARQL, JSON, Markdown, Svelte, React, JavaScript, Rust, etc... ActivityPub and Solid compatible

excerpt: RxDB is a fast, local-first NoSQL-database for JavaScript Applications like Websites, hybrid Apps, Electron-Apps, Progressive Web Apps and Node.js

title: SignalDB
excerpt: SignalDB is a reactive, local-first JavaScript database with real-time sync, Optimistic UI and signal-based reactivity

excerpt: A cross-platform runtime for Web developers to build desktop & mobile apps for any OS using any frontend library. - socketsupply/socket

title: Amplify DataStore
excerpt: Amplify DataStore provides a programming model for leveraging shared and distributed data without writing additional code for offline and online scenarios, which makes working with distributed, cross-user data just as simple as working with local-only data. AWS Amplify Documentation

title: hocuspocus

title: Jamsocket
excerpt: The platform for scaling sync engines, based on the infra behind Figma and Google Docs. With first class support for Y-Sweet, a Yjs realtime sync engine.

title: Liveblocks Storage
excerpt: Liveblocks Storage is a realtime sync engine designed for multiplayer creative tools such as Figma, Pitch, and Spline.

title: Liveblocks Yjs
excerpt: Liveblocks Yjs is a realtime sync engine designed for collaborative text editors such as Notion and Google Docs.

title: Nullboard
excerpt: Nullboard is a minimalist take on a kanban board / a task list manager, designed to be compact, readable and quick in use.

title: TiddlyWiki
excerpt: TiddlyWiki is a complete interactive wiki in JavaScript. It can be used as a single HTML file in the browser or as a powerful Node.js application. It is highly customisable - the entire user interface is itself implemented in hackable WikiText.
